the regina pullover yoke you will first work the yoke of the pullover this is worked in a modified raglan construction meaning you will either stop increasing or change the rate of your raglan increases in different sections of the yoke instead of increasing at a constant rate like in a classic raglan construction this ensures the depth of your yoke does not become overly deep and that you will have a better fit at the upper arm with your us size 8 5 mm needles or larger needles cast on 152 168 178 190 204 216 228 240 252 264 stitches using a provisional cast on with scrap yarn in a color different from your main yarn make sure to add a knot after the last stitch so you know which side to undo the cast-on from when you go to work the collar place bor marker and join in the round being careful not to twist knit 3 rounds in stockinette you will now place markers to establish the raglan locations your bor marker will be located at the center of the back each marker will be identified as m1 m2 etc for a total of eight markers i recommend using markers that look different from your bor marker so that you can distinguish the bor marker from the raglan markers tip if this is your first time working a modified raglan i recommend making markers m1 m4 m5 and m8 one color and markers m2 m3 m6 and m7 a different color markers m1 m4 m5 and m8 are the markers for increases on the body and markers m2 m3 m6 and m7 are the markers for increases on the sleeves the body markers will be color coded blue and the sleeve markers will be color coded green in the rest of the pattern raglan setup k 20 23 24 26 29 30 32 35 36 38 place m1 k1 place m2 k 34 36 38 40 40 44
